tn.text: John continues to describe what he saw in his vision of the throne of God.
"After I saw those things, I saw"

tn.ref: the one who was seated on the throne
tn.text: This is the same "one" as in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:04:01|4:2-3]].

tn.ref: a scroll written on the front side and the back side
tn.text: "a scroll with writing on the front and the back"

tn.ref: It had been sealed with seven seals
tn.text: "It had seven seals keeping it closed"

tn.ref: Who is worthy to open the scroll and break its seals?
tn.text: The person would need to break the seals in order to open the scroll. AT: "Who is worthy to break the seals and open the scroll?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_events]])

tn.ref: Who is worthy to open the scroll and break its seals?
tn.text: This can be translated as a command: "Let the one who is worthy to do this come break the seals and open the scroll!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: in heaven or on the earth or under the earth
tn.text: This means everywhere: the place where God and the angels live, the place where people and animals live, and the place where those who have died are. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
"Listen" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you"

tn.ref: The Lion of the tribe of Judah
tn.text: This is a title for the man  from the tribe of Judah that God had promised would be the great king. AT: "The one who is called the Lion of the Tribe of Judah" or "The king who is called the Lion of the Tribe of Judah"
The king is spoken of as if he were a lion because a lion is very strong.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This is a title for the descendant of David that God had promised would be the great king. AT: "the one who is called the Root of David"
The descendant is spoken of as if David's family were a tree and he were a root of that tree. AT: "the Descendant of David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The Lamb appears in the throne room. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]])
A "lamb" is a young male sheep. Here is it used symbolically to refer to Christ. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])

The number seven is a symbol of completeness and perfection.  The "seven spirits" refers either to the Spirit of God or to seven spirits who serve God. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:01:04|1:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])

tn.ref: sent out over all the earth
tn.text: This can be translated with an active verb. AT: "that God sent out over all the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
He approached the throne. Some languages would use the verb "come". AT: "He came" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_go]])
This is a young male sheep. Here is it used symbolically to refer to Christ. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:05:06|5:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
four elders** - "24 elders." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:04:04|4:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"lay down on the ground." Their faces were toward the ground.
Possible meanings are 1) "each of the elders and living creatures" or 2) "each of the elders."

tn.ref: a golden bowl full of incense, which is the prayers of the believers
tn.text: The incense here is a symbol for the believers' prayers to God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "For they slaughtered you" or "For people killed you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
If your language has a word for killing an animal for a sacrifice, consider using it here.
Since blood represents a person's life, losing the blood represents dying. This probably means "by your death" or "by dying." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"you bought people so that they could belong to God" or "you paid the price so that people could belong to God"

tn.ref: from every tribe, language, people, and nation
tn.text: This means that people from every ethnic group are included.

tn.ref: ten thousands of ten thousands and thousands of thousands
tn.text: Use an expression in your language that shows that it is a huge number. AT: "millions" or "too many thousands to count" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"The Lamb is worthy"

tn.ref: to receive power, wealth, wisdom, strength, honor, glory, and praise
tn.text: These are all things that the Lamb has. Being praised for having them is spoken of as receiving them. AT: "to be praised for his glory, wealth, wisdom, strength, honor, glory." See how you translated a similar sentence in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:04:09|4:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This means that he deserves that everyone should praise him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: in heaven and on the earth and under the earth
tn.text: his means everywhere: the place where God and the angels live, the place where people and animals live, and the place where those who have died are. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:05:03|5:3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: To the one who sits on the throne and to the Lamb, be praise, honor, glory
tn.text: The verb "give" can be used to show how praise, honor, and glory are "to" the one on the throne and the Lamb. AT: "We must give praise, honor, and glory to him who sits on the throne and to the Lamb"

tn.ref: and the power to rule, forever and ever
tn.text: The verb "have" can be used to show how power can be "to" the one on the throne and the Lamb. AT: "and may they have the power to rule forever and ever"
